data.title: Obituary for Nina (Bradshaw) Adams
data.meta_description:
Nina Bradshaw Adams, of Charlottesville, VA, died January 3, 2017 at the age of 89.

She was born in Breeding, Kentucky, to the late Oscar and Elsie Bradshaw.  In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Cecil Adams and her brother and sister-in-law,...
data.text:
Nina Bradshaw Adams, of Charlottesville, VA, died January 3, 2017 at the age of 89.

She was born in Breeding, Kentucky, to the late Oscar and Elsie Bradshaw. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Cecil Adams and her brother and sister-in-law, Kimble and Jean Bradshaw.

Nina was an avid University of Virginia baseball fan and a lifetime member of the General Federation of Woman’s Club, the Shadwell Chapter of the DAR and a lifetime member of the DOE Club. She was a Welcome Wagon hostess for many years.

Survivors include:

Her daughters and son-in-law – Jan A. Jones, Nan and David Harlow of Rural Retreat, VA

Her step-children – Harold and Flora Adams, Martha Chambers of Smithville, TX, Richard and Susie Adams of Houston, TX

Six grandchildren, five step-grandchildren and eleven great-grandchildren

Graveside service – Saturday, January 7, 2017 at 1:00 P.M. at the Fudge Cemetery in Breeding

In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Shriner’s Hospital for Children, 950 West Farris Road, Greenville, SC 29605

Grissom-Martin Funeral Home is assisting with local arrangements
